poker

Class LocalStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.TwitterStream
      • poker.LocalStream

  • public class LocalStream
extends TwitterStream
    A subclass of TwitterStream but replaces the twitter input and output with console input and output by overriding the parseResponse() and addToTweet(String) methods. This class can be used for testing the program as there is no use of the Twitter API and as such, no need to wait for the API rate limits.
    Author:
    Dara Callinan, Jazheel Luna, Eoghan O'Donnell, Crischelle Pana

      • addToTweet

        public void addToTweet(java.lang.String string)
        Description copied from class: TwitterStream
        Adds a String to the current output message that has not yet been sent. If adding the string would make the tweet too long, TwitterStream.sendTweet(java.lang.String) is called, and the current message is emptied. The string is then added to the message. If the initial string exceeds the character limit then the string will be broken up into multiple tweets.
        Overrides:
        addToTweet in class TwitterStream
        Parameters:
        string - The String to be added to the current output message.
        See Also:
        TwitterStream.sendTweet(String)

      • completeMessage

        Description copied from class: TwitterStream
        Sends whatever the current message is, as long as it is not empty.
        Overrides:

      • parseResponse

        public java.lang.String parseResponse()
        Description copied from class: TwitterStream
        Continuously checks for a reply to the latest tweet, by the TwitterStream.user and returns a String of the text of the reply status if it finds one.
        Overrides:
        parseResponse in class TwitterStream
        Returns:
        The text of a reply by the TwitterStream.user to the latest tweet.
